etymology.description: 美(美) (měi, "American") + 元(元) (yuán, "dollar") indicate the currency of the United States.
etymology.interpretation: The word 美元(美元) (měiyuán, "US dollar") combines 美(美) (měi, "American") to signify the Americas or things related to the United States, and 元(元) (yuán, "dollar") which is a common term for currency units, to specifically denote the currency of the US.

examples.chinese: 我有一百美元(我有一百美元)。
examples.english: I have one hundred US dollars.

examples.chinese: 这件商品价格为五十美元(這件商品價格為五十美元)，十分便宜(十分便宜)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiàn shāngpǐn jiàgé wéi wǔ shí měiyuán, shífēn piányí.
examples.english: This item is priced at fifty US dollars, which is very cheap.

examples.chinese: 他存了很多美元(他存了很多美元)，计划去美国旅游(計劃去美國旅遊)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cúnle hěn duō měiyuán, jìhuà qù měiguó lǚyóu.
examples.english: He has saved a lot of US dollars and plans to travel to the United States.
